comments:
The error message is "Specify a valid XML Schema and try loading again". 

Pre-condition:
a. Have the following java file in your project

package web;
/**
 * @model
 */
public class Spider {
	/**
	 * @model
	 */
	public String identifier;
	/**
	 * @model
	 */
	public String reference;
}

Steps are:
1. File | New | EMF Models, Next
2. Pick your project, Next
3. "Load from annotated java", Next
4. Next page is empty (no packages to select from)

The task window shows new error:

Note that the source java file has class (not the interface as required). 
Still the message should not be there. And it would be great to throw some 
hint for the user as how to fix the problem.

The null pointer error fix is committed to CVS.

The build is trying to create a EEnum from the class, and an EEnumLiteral from 
the field and normally there's a value specified; that's the only valid possible 
interpretation of @model annotations on a field in a class.  I'm not sure what 
you were expecting the interpretation to be. but that's the one you'll get.
The fix is available in the latest build.
